Basic concepts of the database for measurements¶

QSweepy is a python-based piece of software designed for measurement automation and management. It has several key components:

Basic data structures for measurements and datasets

class qsweepy.ponyfiles.data_structures.MeasurementParameter(*param, **kwargs)¶

Sweep parameter data structure. Data structure has a function (setter), which makes it impractical for serialization.

qsweepy.ponyfiles.data_structures.measurer_point_parameters(measurer)¶

Constructs dictionary of lists containing MeasurementParameter for every parameter

Parameters

measurer – an object that supports get_points(), measure(), get_dtype() and get_opts() methods. e.g. Spectrum_M3i2132

Returns

dictionary containing lists of MeasurementParameter instances

Return type

dict[str, list[MeasurementParameter]]

See also

sweepy.instrument_drivers.Spectrum_M3i2132

Example for measurer that supports get_points()

Savingloading meassurements and other data using the exdir format TODO: add link

class qsweepy.ponyfiles.save_exdir.LazyMeasParFromExdir(exdir_parameter)¶

Sweep parameter data structure. Data structure has a function (setter), which makes it impractical for serialization.

qsweepy.ponyfiles.save_exdir.load_exdir(filename: str, db: qsweepy.ponyfiles.database.MyDatabase = None, filename_db: str = None, lazy: bool = False)¶

Loads measurement state from ExDir file system and database if the latter is provided.

Parameters

  • filename (str) – Absolute path to the exdir file.

  • db (MyDatabase) – Binded pony database instance.

  • lazy (bool) – If True, function leaves ExDir file open and sets retval.exdir to this file.

Returns

MeasurementState – Measurement state that is obtained from combining data from ExDir by filename and from PostSQL by finding record with the same filename

Return type

retval

qsweepy.ponyfiles.save_exdir.save_exdir(state: qsweepy.ponyfiles.data_structures.MeasurementState, keep_open: bool = False)¶

The main function

Managing and finding measurements in a database using PonyORM and a Postgresql database

class qsweepy.ponyfiles.database.MyDatabase(provider='postgres', user='qsweepy', password='qsweepy', host='localhost', database='qsweepy', port=5432)¶

This class does smth

create_in_database(state)¶

Creates entity instance in program memory space and commits it into the database.

Parameters

state (MeasurementState) –

Returns

id – state database id

Return type

int

class qsweepy.ponyfiles.exdir_db.Exdir_db(db, sample_name=None, old_prefix='', new_prefix='')¶

Exdir class

save(**values)¶

Constructs MeasurementState instance from values dictionary and saves it into exdir_db system.

Parameters

values (dict) – dictionary that contains values for MyDatabase.Data etc. that fully describe measurement state.

Returns

measurement state constructed

Return type

MeasurementState

Saves measurement state to the exdir_db system.

Parameters

data (MeasurementState) –

Returns

Return type

Load first encountered measurement state from SQL that corresponds to parameters provided.

Parameters

  • measurement_type –

  • metadata –

  • references_this –

  • references_that –

  • ignore_invalidation –

Returns

  • MeasurementState – measurement state that contains all datasets and corresponding parameter values

  • that corresponds to the parameters provided.

select_measurements_db(measurement_type: str, metadata: Mapping[str, str] = None, references_this: Mapping[str, int] = None, references_that: Mapping[str, int] = None, ignore_invalidation: bool = False)¶

PonyORM select clause with where constraints on Data table (which correspond to MeasurementState classes)

Parameters

  • measurement_type (str) – where measurement_type == {measurement_type} clauase

  • metadata –

  • references_this –

  • references_that –

  • ignore_invalidation –

Returns

List of MyDatabase.Data instances. Each instance represents separate record in Data table of database.

Return type

MyDatabase.Data
